column39: Roman Catholic Cathedral in Jakarta, Indonesia
column125: This was one of thirty-nine related attacks (cf. 200012240001-39). Many of the bombs were placed in cars outside churches, and all detonated at the same time of day. All of the attacks targeted the minority Christian population in Indonesia. Several militant Islamic groups and separatist fighters in the restive northwestern province of Aceh denied involvement in the bombings.
